channel.title: Making a custom item weildable
channel.description:
Recently added some customs items on my Project insanity source. Looked at methods, looked through files, and tested things for around an hour, still couldn't figure this out. It's simple on a delta source, but i can't figure out how on my PI source. Whenever i wear a custom loaded item, it automatically equips to the helmet equipment slot. Any ideas on how to change that, or make an weapon wield able to the weapon slot? Thanks.
Ps - New mopar account, don't judge the pc.

item.title: Making a custom item weildable
item.dc:creator: @kickyamom50 kickyamom50
item.description:
@kickyamom50 wrote:

Guys, you add the ints in the class8.java.
Here is example, and wear it says “wear” in mine, the one on yours make it say “wield”

if(i == 8007) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wear"; class8.anIntArray156 = new int[5]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int[5]; class8.anInt174 = 601; class8.anInt181 = 2000; class8.anInt190 = 500; class8.anInt198 = 0; class8.anInt169 = -6; class8.anInt194 = 1; class8.anInt204 = 14; class8.anInt165 = 600; class8.anInt200 = 600; class8.anInt175 = -1; class8.anInt197 = -1; class8.anInt199 = -1; class8.aString170 = "Wings Of Saradomin"; class8.aByteArray178 = "Rosejuice's wings of saradomin".getBytes(); }
Then add the item id to the correct place in your item.java in your source, not item.cfg, item.java, do it in correct area though

Read full topic

item.title: Making a custom item weildable
item.dc:creator: @Cowarooroo Cowarooroo
item.description:
@Cowarooroo wrote:

hahabob2:

Honestly, i don’t know. I’m not good with models, only java programming itself.

Well I’m 90% sure it has to do with the int’s in class 8 of the client.
